SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc19
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.Model.Station

Class Station

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.Model.Publisher
it.polimi.ingsw.gc19.Model.Station.Station
public class Station extends Publisher
This class represents the player' area. It manages cards in hand, visible symbols, private goal card selection and, throughout CardSchema, let player place cards and updates points.

    • placeInitialCard

      This method place initial card in card schema

    • placeInitialCard

      public void placeInitialCard(CardOrientation cardOrientation)
      This method place initial card in card schema

    • cardIsPlaceable

      public boolean cardIsPlaceable(PlayableCard anchor, PlayableCard toPlace, Direction direction) throws InvalidCardException, InvalidAnchorException
      This method checks if a card can be placed in CardSchema
      Returns:
      true if and only if card is in station and is placeable in CardSchema.
      Throws:
      InvalidCardException - if station doesn't have the card to place.
      InvalidAnchorException - if the anchor isn't in card schema.

    • placeCard

      public boolean placeCard(PlayableCard anchor, PlayableCard toPlace, Direction direction, CardOrientation cardOrientation) throws InvalidCardException, InvalidAnchorException
      This method place a card in CardSchema if it's placeable in CardSchema If the card has been placed it updates station's points and visible symbols. Then updates cards in hand.
      Throws:
      InvalidCardException - if station doesn't have the card to place.
      InvalidAnchorException - if the anchor isn't in card schema.

    • setVisibleSymbols

      private void setVisibleSymbols(PlayableCard toPlace)
      Updates visible symbols in Station after toPlace card has been placed
      Parameters:
      toPlace - the PlayableCard that has been placed

    • getCardsInHand

      public List<PlayableCard> getCardsInHand()
      This method returns visible cards in station
      Returns:
      visible cards in station

    • cardOverAnchor

      public boolean cardOverAnchor(PlayableCard anchor, Direction dir) throws InvalidCardException
      This method checks if there is a card over the anchor in Direction dir Throws InvalidCardException is the anchor doesn't exist in schema.
      Returns:
      true if and only if there is card ver the anchor in Direction dir
      Throws:
      InvalidCardException - if station doesn't have the card to place.

    • getCardWithAnchor

      public Optional<PlayableCard> getCardWithAnchor(PlayableCard anchor, Direction dir) throws InvalidCardException
      This method returns an optional of card placed from the anchor in the specified direction; optional is empty if this card doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      anchor - the anchor from which the method starts searching
      dir - the direction of the search
      Returns:
      an Optional<PlayableCard> describing the card
      Throws:
      InvalidCardException - if station doesn't have the card to place.

    • getLastPlaced

      public Optional<PlayableCard> getLastPlaced()
      This method returns an optional of card containing the last placed card; optional is empty if no cards has been placed.
      Returns:
      an Optional<PlayableCard> describing the last placed card

    • cardIsInSchema

      public boolean cardIsInSchema(PlayableCard card)
      This method checks if card has been placed
      Parameters:
      card - the card to search for
      Returns:
      true if and only if the card has been placed.

    • getCardCodeSchema

      public Optional<String>[][] getCardCodeSchema()
      This method returns the schema where each card is described by its name Optional is empty if in (x, y) there is no card
      Returns:
      a String matrix with all the visible cards codes.

    • getCardOrientationSchema

      public Optional<CardOrientation>[][] getCardOrientationSchema()
      This method returns the orientation of each card in the schema Optional is empty if in (x, y) there is no card
      Returns:
      a String matrix with all the visible cards codes.

    • getCardOverlap

      public int[][] getCardOverlap()
      This method returns a matrix with 0 if in (x, y) there's no card otherwise a sequential number representing the order of card placing. If getCardOverlap()[x][y] > getCardOverlap()[i][j] then card in position [x][y] has been placed after card in position [i][j]
      Returns:
      an integer matrix representing current overlapping situation

    • countPattern

      public int countPattern(ArrayList<Tuple<Integer,Integer>> moves, ArrayList<Symbol> requiredSymbol)
      This method returns the number of specified pattern in card schema
      Parameters:
      moves - the Arraylist of movement inside card schema
      requiredSymbol - the ArrayList of required seeds of each card in the pattern
      Returns:
      the number of the specified pattern found

      Parameters:
      cardIdx - the index of the GoalCard
      Returns:

      Parameters:

    • getPlacedCardSequence

      public List<Tuple<PlayableCard,Tuple<Integer,Integer>>> getPlacedCardSequence()
      Getter for placing sequence: each PlayableCard in the returned list is associated with its coords in CardSchema
      Returns:
      the placing card sequence of this Station
